body.description: Product Description LG AEM69493803 Dishwasher Drain Hose Assembly. Black rubber hose goes to the top of the water inlet housing on the side of the dishwasher. You may need to order item #1267810 as well. For use with the following LG Electronics models: D1607BB, LDF6810WW, LDS4821BB, LDF6920WW, D1401TB, LD6310TB1, LDF9810ST, LDF8812ST, LD6100BB, LD6105BB, LDF7811BB, D1608BB, D1613BB, LD6300BB, LD6090TB1, LD6090TB2, LD6100TB1, D1412TB, LD6105TB1, LDF7810ST, D1607TB, LDF7932BB, LDF7810WW, D1607WB, LDS4821ST, LDS5811BB, LD6100TB, LD6105TB, LDS4821WW, LDF7811ST, LDF6810BB, D1608TB, D1613TB, LD6100WB, LD6105WB, LDF9932ST, LD6300TB, LD6310TB, LDF6920BB, LDF7811WW, D1608WB, D1613WB, LD6090BB1, LD6090BB2, LD6300WB, LD6100BB1, LD6105BB1, D1401TB1, LDF7932ST, LDS5811ST. productInformation.value: #125,174 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement) #210 in Dishwasher Replacement Hoses

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fairly easy to install and plug black hose with pex plug
reviews.reviewText: I have a circa 2007 LG5815WW/1 that does not use the extra black vent hose. The old hose I removed was 12' long and this one appears to be a bit shorter, maybe 10'. For me, that's not a big deal, especially if your dishwasher is right next to the sink. But if I had it to do over again, I would have just purchased the LG 12' drain hose that would have replaced exactly what I removed (no extra black hose to begin with).The installation went pretty smoothly, but the way that the hoses are glued into the "U" shaped tube is off so that when you connect the hose to the bottom port on the dishwasher, the "U" hung sideways rather than flush with the side of the unit. I was able to use zip ties to help, but it was the dishwasher side panel that is forcing it to be flush.The other thing is the extra black hose... I could have purchased a new 4975DD1001A Dishwasher Guide Assembly (1267810 AH3524749 EA3524749 PS3524749) that accepts the black hose (mine is really gunked up from the looks of it) but I figured why spend another $108 on a 16yr. old dishwasher... Some have said to plug it up with epoxy. For me, I bought a ½" black plastic pex 'plug' at Home Cheapo and used that to plug it up. Worked tight, but really well. Since the black hose is at the top of the unit, I doubt it's going to get much water anyway.Lastly, I plan to put a water sensor under my unit (Simplisafe detector in my case) as the hose started leaking and it wasn't until drywall damage to the downstairs ceiling did we realized what was going on. Then again, it took almost 10 years in the present location for the hole to develop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does not fit my LG Dishwasher
reviews.reviewText: This product would have received a 5 if it drain cord fit my dishwasher. The cord to the dishwasher pump was too short. The cord to the sink was just right. Dishwasher model was LDF7551ST

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install and value for money

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2015
reviews.reviewText: It's what was expected and fits my LG dishwasher (LDF6920ST) perfectly - probably the exact same as original. Very easy to install (there is a YouTube video explaining it well) as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars like mine. It works perfect and is priced fairly
reviews.reviewText: This hose is sold universally, but some dishwashers will not utilize the black hose shown in the product photo. You will have to cap off the hose in certain models, like mine. It works perfect and is priced fairly, and I couldn't be happier.You may have to take the time to close off the black tube, but the rest of the repair is straight forward.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OEM part, perfect fit for LDF6920ST
reviews.reviewText: Dishwasher Drain Hose of LDF6920ST finally leaked, and did that during the lock-down. Not fun.There are several identical parts that fit this model, the newest AEM69493807 is a replacement for older AEM69493803. I still ordered this older part, and Amazon delivered it in less than 2 days, despite the Corona mess. Thank you Amazon!The assembly included all the essential parts and clamps. It got installed in ~15 minutes with some mild muttering as the replacement involves a lot of laying on the floor and reaching some places under the dishwasher.No more leaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not the right size for my machine - buyer beware.
reviews.reviewText: This was not the right size for my dishwasher even though it was listed as a viable replacement. It looks almost exactly the same as the one I was trying to replace (due to those *&^% 0E errors!), but the length of pipe from the pump to the U-tube part was much, much shorter. Even though it installed okay, I couldn't get the dishwasher to run successfully more than once. There seemed to be some kind of vacuum lock. In the end, I pulled it all out, put back the old one and I'm still looking for a correct replacement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This vender got me the part very quick. ==(5 stars)But the part DOES NOT FIT (LG Model LDF7774ST ) DishwashersHad to rig it!
The hose that goes to the pump is about 18" short. I tried to reroute but it created too much back pressure so I had to get and extention hose to make work properly..... very disappointing
